args.query: mathlib4 compact_space implies sequentially compact metric 'compact_space_iff_sequentially_compact' 'sequentially_compact_of_compact' 'CompactSpace.sequentially_compact' 'metric' Mathlib4

args.natural_language_statement:
Let X be a metric space such that every open cover of X has a finite subcover. Prove that every sequence in X has a convergent subsequence.

Translate to Lean4. Use Mathlib import and end the statement with := by sorry. Create a lemma showing that a compact metric space is sequentially compact: for a metric space X, [MetricSpace X] and [CompactSpace X] imply that every sequence (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X) has a subsequence that converges to some x : X.

open Lean Meta Elab Tactic
open MessageData
def ppAC (ccs : CCState) : MessageData := sorry"}

import Mathlib

open Filter

lemma compact_metric.sequentially_compact {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] [CompactSpace X] (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X) :
  ‚àÉ (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï) (hœÜ : StrictMono œÜ) (x : X), Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) atTop (ùìù x) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Filter

lemma compact_metric.sequentially_compact {X : Type _} [MetricSpace X] [CompactSpace X] (u : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X) :
  ‚àÉ (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï) (hœÜ : StrictMono œÜ) (x : X), Filter.Tendsto (u ‚àò œÜ) atTop (nhds x) := by sorry
